An RSA key was carelessly generated, leaking the upper half of its private exponent. Can you decrypt the secret message? 1582005271512388403350936276978445149006399896666650607857718720753757116662318310880764163636201114355342780279174544845595948221766276222911828697681111

The flag format is flag{...}
n=9047144445912956637801924386561825610826504489160128031344219065863890587559834665594730210158418604663688526498685813230929792013883886351026790474673199, e=55700718404779996701983948703706898214409594656423711527870191343735615960993845848482426281568353438284594017861858346260577676716680832233252765790229, partial_p=16632270699880017222

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{ezc83nrg}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1582005271512388403350936276978445149006399896666650607857718720753757116662318310880764163636201114355342780279174544845595948221766276222911828697681111
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=9047144445912956637801924386561825610826504489160128031344219065863890587559834665594730210158418604663688526498685813230929792013883886351026790474673199, e=55700718404779996701983948703706898214409594656423711527870191343735615960993845848482426281568353438284594017861858346260577676716680832233252765790229, partial_p=16632270699880017222
extra_info: p=104402455273637899535973209317574513000551376614638873467270932689058922633791, q=86656433722755582065850956561694740126354730776066580853870626496767288463889, Ï†(n)=9047144445912956637801924386561825610826504489160128031344219065863890587559643606705733816676816780497809257245558907123539086559562744791840964263575520
subtype: partial_key_exposure
archetype: rsa
